subsection_analysis.refined_text: In this section, we explored the world of PDF exporting in Acrobat. We learned about the different features and options available in Acrobat, such as Autosave and File > Save. We also discussed the challenges and best practices in PDF exporting. So, are you ready to become an expert in PDF exporting? Let's dive in!

The Advanced Editing mode can be selected if you have added one signer to the document.

The simplified option is displayed for single signers and is available as an 
Advanced Editing mode option.

If you have added multiple signers to the document, the advanced editing mode is 
enabled.

Advanced editing mode enables the use of the simplified option for the same 
signers you have added to the document.

Advanced Editing mode is disabled if the document is not signed or if the document 
contains other fields.

For details on the Advanced Editing mode, click on the Advanced Edit menu item for 
more information.

The Signing window is displayed showing options for

This mode simplifies authoring by allowing you to assign fields to multiple signers. When you select a signer from the right pane and add fields in the 
form, the fields will be assigned to the signer. That means those fields will be available to the signer for filling 
the information and signing the form.

Example:

```python
from django import forms
from django.conf import settings

class SignerForm(forms.Form):
    # Fields for multiple signers
    name = forms.CharField(max_length=100, label='Signer Name')
    email = forms.EmailField(max_length=254, label='Sign

- You can select multiple certificates using the select option.
- You can also select certificates that meet specific requirements or conditions.
- You can trust certificates that meet specific requirements or conditions.
- The certificate’s trust level is displayed in the 'Trust Certificate' window.
- The 'Certificate Trust' dialog opens, which allows you to select one or more certificates to 
trust using the select and 'Edit Certificate Trust' options.

This section explains how to use the Fill & Sign tools for HTML forms. You can create an interactive form by using the Prepare Forms tool, enable the Fill & Sign tools, or create a fillable form by enabling the Fill & Sign tools from the hamburger menu. The Fill & Sign tools are enabled for the current form only.

Use Case 1: Creating an Interactive Form

Scenario: You are a web developer working on a new website. You need to create an interactive form to allow users to register for a website. The form will collect information about the user's email and password.

Conversation:

Developer: I need to create an interactive form to allow users to register for the website.
